intro: Lepigonum grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered lepigonum, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible parts. Lepigonum grandiflorum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
